Text:
Thanks man, really cool! 
Maybe you only should add in the end of the simplified setup info (step 19) that the OS 9 must be installed to newly created volume. BTW I copied the System Folder from OS9 image at first boot. Works very well for now, but I haven't fully checked it yet. I guess it might be some shorter version. Isn't it?
Sorry, I just noticed the UPDATE to step 18 in your torrent description. Forget the suggestion and question in my first post.

One more note. In the longer version of Setup Manual can be found 
For ?Ethernet Interface? enter ?slirp? 
but in the shorter version it is "slurp"

To subnet_mask:

Sorry about the typo, it is spelled  slirp
:)

Thanks Iso_Soul. "slirp" was my final choice also. 
I wish you success with this project!

thanks a lot for this, i deleted my copy awhile back to save space, and have been looking for this again

this worked for me only when i didn't follow one of the last steps to delete os9 from the pref file + it also works without the .iso locked

does anyone know how to install applications onto this, where is the web browser?

To dropacid:

OS 9 doesn't have a default browser but you may use the program, "Classilla". http://www.floodgap.com/software/classilla/
look like he might have given up... Unless he\'s on holidays...
Thanks, I love this! Thanks to this, I got OS 9 up and running on my Mac Mini on OS X Snow Leopard or 10.6.6.
The application just closes as soon as I open it. From what I've read this has something to do with the ROM file not being compatible. I was super excited for this. I hope I can get it to work. =(
Okay, I had to drag the ROM file out of the ROM folder in order to get the app to start-up. It works great now! Thanks so much!
